chapter.title: Overview of MPX and TDF-OS
chapter.para:
TDF-OS is an MPX operating system designed by the Tours de force team in Spring 2009 for the CS 450 Operating Systems course at West Virginia University. For more information on TDF, visit the project's homepage
http://code.google.com/p/tdf-os/.

Presently, the operating system consists of numerous components: the shell of the operating system, process control blocks, as well as their container queues that are associated with them. Other features include: an interupt handler for the operating system, and a serial port emulator.
The developer's manual is designed to document the source of the project such that any new developer can read the documentation and be thoroughly informed of how the project is mapped out.
